title: Can AP have some love
body:
Sooo The AD items got some buffs to make them have 80 AD again due to the new tank items that were released. So can AP get some of that treatment(Give AP items more AP). Also GA is now not viable for AP mages due to the AD it gives(wasted stat). 
Also I think mages need another penetration item too. Currently we only have {{item:3020}} {{item:3135}}  and {{item:3151}} . While AD has {{item:3147}} {{item:3814}} {{item:3142}} {{item:3071}} {{item:3033}} {{item:3036}} .
Basically, can AP get some buffs Rito?
*#*MakeAPgreatagain

replies.body:
people dont want better existing AP items. they want the option or the opportunity of high AP builds again.

the old DFG/sorc boots/rab cap/void/CDR/zhonyas build is gone (120 + 120 + 120 + 70 + i believe morellos used to be 80, and grail was 60? correct me if im wrong) with 30% pen from void, 15% max hp from DFG, and the bonus 20% magic damage for 4s. it was quite the ramp up for mages. which said "damage" and their only defense was a zhonyas active.

ludens is not a dfg replacement, roa (was briefly 120AP, acted as an inefficient replacement), zhonyas was lowered, no other 120 ap/armor option offered.

basically we need 2 new 120 AP items, regardless of whats attached to them.

dont tell me hextech/morellos/ its tons of damages, no its not, people want maximum scaling, not CDR and second rotations.

{{item:3003}} (though tear could use some buff to be less of a burden) if people ignore the biggest ap item and then complain about not haveing big ap, well....
I'm not agianst some bigger ap items with less utillity, but if you really wan't to reach big numbers lategame, you DO have the options to do so already.
Rabbadons could use a small buff to the buildpath and combine costs though, it's just not an attractive item most of the time.

tell me again why i shouldn't just build -> {{item:3070}} ->  {{item:3027}}  x4 -> {{item:3040}} -> {{item:3089}} ?

its technically the highest AP build...

its because it incredibly slow, doesn't spike when you need it to and leaves you without key stats like cdr or pen.

On the pen side, I'd push for further nerfs to armor pen rather than buffs for magic pen, but maybe one more item would be ok.

As for buffing numbers up again, YES PLEASE. The reason mages like Brand and Zyra have been feeling oppressive is because they can get away with dealing a lot of damage with comparatively low AP. Boosting the raw AP mages have access to would be a buff to the straight scalers and the utility mages (high AP means better shields than with Liandry's for instance).

Armor pen was just nerfed on the % side. Lethality is balanced right now and thank god. Still, I wouldn't mind a few mage itemization buffs and nerfs. 

Nerfs I said? Yeah, Morellonomicon {{item:3165}} . Either cut 1 amp tome from the build path and make it give 85 AP or making it give only 10% CDR. It's too strong of an item. You could say the same for cleaver, but we're talking about mages right now. Trying to increase diversity without giving such a 1 item do everything; this opens up room to buff other mage items.

Luden's Echo {{item:3285}} could use a very nice buff that seems to been given to everyone: a cost reduction. Reduce cost by 200 gold (3200 -> 3000).

Rylai's Crystal Scepter {{item:3116}} needs 1 kind of change. The passive can stay as mediocre as it is, but this item has shown it's problems in it's current state. First off, it's being built easily for mage "supports" due to it's low cost. Secondarily, the stats aren't slot efficient enough for an item slot. +100 HP, +5 AP (80 AP, 400 HP), cost increased to 3000, build path changes to Blasting Wand + Amp Tome + Giant's Belt + 715 Gold. Passive stays the same, item just becomes worth the slot it's in decently; Supports won't be able to buy the item. If Zyra would need a buff, buff Zyra.

Seeker's Armguard {{item:3191}} sounds nice to beat AD assassins, but is actually worse than going damage mostly. Changes are simple. +5 armor and +5 AP, but the passive caps at 20 stacks (10 extra armor/AP) from 30 (15 extra).

Zhonya's Hourglass {{item:3157}} is a huge staple item in every AP build. Too huge of a buff would put it overboard. As such, a very simple +5 AP would suffice. Seeing as Seeker's Armguard would be a better rush, a small buff is warranted and fine.

Rabadon's Deathcap {{item:3089}} is the #1 AP item, but it suffers one huge downside. Cost reduced by 200 gold.

Moonflair Spellblade {{item:3170}} brought to Summoner's Rift for AP bruisers and fighters (Diana, Kayle, perhaps Ekko). However a few changes are warranted. +150 gold cost, +10 AP.

Void Staff {{item:3135}} gets a Last Whisper treatment. With all the buffs in other items, the "tank killing" item needs to stop contributing too much to the death of a non-tank. 35% Magic Pen changed to 35% Bonus Magic Pen.

Hextech Items {{item:3030}} {{item:3152}} {{item:3146}} {{item:3145}} lose their "Hextech" clause so they can actually be balanced individually. Hextech-GLP's effect cast time reduced by half, cooldown stays the same. Hextech Protobelt's cooldown increased to 60 seconds, +5 AP, +100 cost. Hextech Gunblade's active cooldown increased to 60 seconds and Leblanc's AoE Q now counts as AoE damage instead of single target (no more massive sustain). Revolver stays the same. Yes you can stack Hextech items, but that doesn't sound too unbalanced.

Zeke's Harbinger {{item:3050}} needs a lot of changes. First off, Conduit effect window increased to 10 seconds from 8. Percent AP increase bonus increased to 25%. 50% Critical Chance bonus changes to 25% attack speed + 25% more AD. Makes the item bindable to just about everyone.

Pox Arcana added to Summoner's Rift. Cooldown reduction reduced to 10%. Mana regen stat changed for 400 Mana (to fit Lost Chapter). http://leagueoflegends.wikia.com/wiki/Pox_Arcana

Sounds like a ton of buffs for mages, however they do trade off losing Morello as a 1 item big ticket. Outlying mages can be buffed or nerfed, but the class as a whole, including AP assassins and fighters, could use a tiny buff. Also this will encourge diversity in mage items instead of Morello Void Hourglass.

>Rylai's Crystal Scepter needs 1 kind of change. The passive can stay as mediocre as it is, but this item has shown it's problems in it's current state. First off, it's being built easily for mage "supports" due to it's low cost. Secondarily, the stats aren't slot efficient enough for an item slot. +100 HP, +5 AP (80 AP, 400 HP), cost increased to 3000, build path changes to Blasting Wand + Amp Tome + Giant's Belt + 715 Gold. Passive stays the same, item just becomes worth the slot it's in decently; Supports won't be able to buy the item. If Zyra would need a buff, buff Zyra.

If you buff the AP on it, you'll have APs like Ahri, Syndra or other champs who shouldn't be building it frequently all over it again. If anything nerf the AP to say, 70, while increasing the HP and cost instead.

>Zhonya's Hourglass is a huge staple item in every AP build. Too huge of a buff would put it overboard. As such, a very simple +5 AP would suffice. Seeing as Seeker's Armguard would be a better rush, a small buff is warranted and fine.

Not anymore. Shit's garbage stat-wise, only worth it if you _need_ the active or early armor.

>Void Staff gets a Last Whisper treatment. With all the buffs in other items, the "tank killing" item needs to stop contributing too much to the death of a non-tank. 35% Magic Pen changed to 35% Bonus Magic Pen.

Noooooo, nononono. Not without more accessible Magic Pen from other sources. Especially if it goes from 35% total to 35% bonus without any sort of increase to say, 40%.

>Moonflair Spellblade brought to Summoner's Rift for AP bruisers and fighters (Diana, Kayle, perhaps Ekko). However a few changes are warranted. +150 gold cost, +10 AP.

You're signing a death wish there. Do you want Ahri, or LeBlanc, or Lux, or any squishy Mage/AP Assassin running around with some Tank stats and Tenacity while not giving up a lot of damage?

>Yes you can stack Hextech items, but that doesn't sound too unbalanced.

I dunno, do you want someone to point blank Protobelt you into Gunblade active for a shit ton of extra damage?

>Zeke's Harbinger needs a lot of changes. First off, Conduit effect window increased to 10 seconds from 8. Percent AP increase bonus increased to 25%. 50% Critical Chance bonus changes to 25% attack speed + 25% more AD. Makes the item bindable to just about everyone.

Not a real AP item. Tune it to it's bot lane aspects rather than its AP aspects.

>Pox Arcana added to Summoner's Rift. Cooldown reduction reduced to 10%. Mana regen stat changed for 400 Mana (to fit Lost Chapter). 

I'd need new pants.

In addition, nerf the shit out of Lost Chapter. It _completely_ trivializes Mana management where even Tear is worse than it at doing that. As a dedicated Mana item. Give it an effect similar to Doran's Ring or something but remove the 20% max Mana restore on leveling.

+5 AP isn't gonna break Rylais. Shocking.

Zhonya's shouldn;'t have good stats. GA doesn't for a reason.

Void Staff is overpowering right now. Maybe 40% bonus, but that distracts from the point.

They'd have tank stats and barely any AP because the item gives barely. Shocking, I know. Items with trade offs.

Who would build Protobelt and Gunblade? At that point make Hextech items unique but still make them have independent cooldowns.

If its stats are good enough to warrant higher damage focused carries wanting it, that's not good. Rylai's should be about the passive and HP and less about the AP.

And Zhonya's is only good if you want the active which is not a "huge staple item in every AP build". Back when it was 120 AP 50 Armor, yea it was, but not now.

Void Staff requires to be total pen because the only other _good_ source of pen in AP itemization is Sorcerer's Shoes which already stifle APs boot choices. How often you see any boots other than them on an AP? I can only think of Aurelion with swifties.

60 AP, 50 Armor, and 50 MR with 35% Tenacity sounds like a fantastic situational buy, and outright disgusting on HP oriented builds such as RoA/Rylai's/Liandry's builds.

Leblanc, Morde, Rumble, Ekko, just of the top off my head.

Cool, Rylais should be allowed to be build on a high damage carry instead of being a wasted item slot.

Zhonya's is literally build on over half the AP roster.

Void Staff is supposed to be a tank killing item. It does too well as a squishy killer.

Do you want every AP champion and their mother buying Rylai's again?

It's a common item still for sure, but not quite what you're making it out to be.

Old LW was changed to Bonus Armor Pen because it was too good at killing everything. Assassins rushed it as a first or second item. It also innately gave much more value than Void Staff because it penetrated more Armor than Void Staff's Mpen at almost every stage of the game. And then, ADs already have a _plethora_ of Penetration items, between Flat, Reduction, and %Pen. APs have 3 items that give MPen. Technically 4 if you could Guise/Liandry's as two items, but they don't stack. Void and Sorcerer's Shoes are the only two good sources of Penetration available in itemization. If they made Void Staff bonus % pen, they'd have to add more flat pen. And I don't think you want APs running around with 45-60 Flat pen.

Nine Tailed Mystic <3 Again you are being honest even while you are an Ahri Main who uses AP itemization.

I appreciate that.

Thanks, I try.

It's not like I want Ahri to be as strong as she is, or AP itemization to be bonkers, believe it or not.

Is Ahri really "As strong as she is" though?
She's just really safe.
It's not like her damage is that great tbh :/
You've got Lux's out DPSing her in higher Elo's.
The last time I built Hourglass was literally months ago. Zhonyas is a null-factor item right now, you are better off with another pen item.
That's why it's literally it's core on every single AP champion?
It's not

Wow yea, champion.gg is such a reliable quality site
Got any other sites to show full builds? If you don't then this is the most reliable site for showing full builds.

Oh, you mean sites like lolskill.net, mobafire.com, op.gg, etc.?

I can go on, every single one of them is more reliable than champion.gg. It's a garbage site.

Btw, just because something's popular it doesn't mean that it's viable or even good.
Op.gg doesn't display full builds. Mobafire is less reliable.
Whatever floats your boat. Keep using the trash sites, keep on being discredited due to that.

Your entire argument relies on the fact that this website might be unreliable.

But the fact is you fail to discredit it by stating a site that's better for this job.

My entire argument is based on you picking the worst site.

Champion.gg has been proven to display faulty stats when talking about winrate and builds, iirc even a Rioter confirmed that champion.gg doesn't match their stats for a big portion.

I don't need to give you a more reliable site when literally every other site is more reliable.
Like I said. If you want to trust bad sites then do it. But don't try to push it onto others as facts when it has been proven to be a bad site.
you guys stole banshees from us {{champion:150}}
You stole Abyssal from us. While already buying it on Tanks sometimes anyways.

yeah but why the fuck would 

{{champion:122}} {{champion:254}} {{champion:58}} {{champion:420}} {{champion:59}} {{champion:72}} {{champion:106}} etc get abyssal?
Magic dealing teammates. It's not like it has AP anymore, and both Renekton R and Voli R do decent Magic damage.
I just want mages to have more options.

more options ? 

lol like what? 

they have all kinds of fukin options
Not really, almost every mage builds the same thing.
just cuz you choose not to build it.. dont mean there arent any options...
Its not an option for Brand to build tear.
why not ? does he not use mana could he not benefit from having more AP based from having a big mana pool? he gets ROA dont he ?
By that definition everyone could have bought Zhonyas and Hexdrinker would have never been needed.

yes you can getanything on any champ 

whether or not its ideal isnt the argument. its what OPTIONS are available

Some people take things WAY too literal.

When mages say that they got no other options when talking about build diversity it means that there are no other "ideal" builds they could use.
Exactly. He's just nitpicking at this point and grasping for straws.
Heck it doesn't even have to be ideal - just reasonably effective in a not uncommon scenario.
Its so much less effective. I don't need to explain why it is not effective on him.
BUT IT IS AN OPTION. just cuz you might not find it effective dont mean you cant do it
Grave's can go AP and AD than. Because his W has an AP scaling, than all AP items suddenly are options. Right?

yes 

is it ideal? NO but it is an option

In reality though, it is not an option.

Sure, murder is an option if I want to express my anxiety. But its not a realistic, okay one. 

Every champion can buy every item, so in order to have an actual discussion with you, you need to understand that just because a champion can buy it doesn't mean it is a viable option.

It isn't an option for him because you don't get any leverage out of it. An 'option' could be considered an item I could build for a certain situation, and it still be as effective as my core items. There just isn't much variety among AP itemization.

Yeah that's always the case with AP. You don't get diversity really, you just go with whatever gives the most AP. 

It holds every AP user that isn't a mage back.
dont all tanks build nearly the same things? all supports build nearly the same things? all adcs? bruiser? assassins? so on?
Not all supports. You won't see a {{champion:16}} and {{champion:89}} buying more than a couple of the same items at most.
